derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: modern Latin, from Italian sorgo, perhaps based on a variant of Latin syricum 'Syrian'

entry.def: Sorghum is a type of corn that is grown in warm countries. Its grain can be made into flour or syrup.

means.word_mean: 1. economically important Old World tropical cereal grass
2. made from juice of sweet sorghum
